intro: Papaver dubium var. depressum, commonly known as the depressed poppy, is a herbaceous perennial native to Europe. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, often with a contrasting central blotch. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with smooth, ribbed stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
